question: 立派
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>sect</kanji> that <kanji>stand</kanji>s the highest are those who are <vocabulary>high class</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>splendid</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>fine</vocabulary>. <ja>立派だ</ja>!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>りつ</ja> shortens to <ja>りっ</ja> though, so keep an eye on that you splendid frood you. Oh and <ja>は</ja> changes to <ja>ぱ</ja> too. Because rendaku and all that.
